channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024010498
item.description:
Report X-2024010498

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE OVERGOODS SECTION ON BOXLINE 3 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE CORROSIVE LABEL ON BOX AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET, TOOK DOWN TO THE PIT FOR FURTURE PROCESSING

item.title: Report E-2024010100
item.description:
Report E-2024010100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: FREDERICKSBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The container arrived at Veolia's 10 Day In-transit facility located at 24 Commerce Parkway, Fredericksburg, VA 22406 on 12/29/2023. As it was transferred from the original delivering vehicle to the outbound vehicle on 1/4/24, a leak was discovered. The material was transferred to another IBC that was UN rated for the material. Investigation revealed that there was a crack directly behind the valve. It was determined that this was most likely caused by freezing due to the weather.

item.title: Report X-2024010451
item.description:
Report X-2024010451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon sending the package to Van Line 2 package handlers noticed a wet corner on the package. Van Line manager called for QA and they safely secured the leaking hazmat into the Hazmat cage for further inspection and processing. Upon inspecting the hazmat it was found that one of the bottles had a loose cap causing a slow leakage through the package. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose cap causing slow leakage. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: QA rep wore gloves and carefully secured the hazmat into a hazmat bin and brought it to the hazmat processing cage.

item.title: Report E-2024010237
item.description:
Report E-2024010237

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MANASSAS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a pail that was staged on a pallet slightly leaking from the bottom of the pail. Further investigation revealed that the pallet that the pail was staged on had a nail protruding from it that punctured the pail consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbents and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.
